workflowSteps.details: Received prior authorization form, discharge summary, operative report, ECG, 2D Doppler study, and laboratory results
workflowSteps.outcome: All required documents successfully processed - 6 documents including cardiac catheterization report, echocardiogram, and complete lab panel
workflowSteps.comments: Document quality excellent - comprehensive post-NSTEMI documentation with complete cardiac workup

workflowSteps.details: Extracted patient demographics, insurance information, provider details, and cardiac history
workflowSteps.outcome: Patient: Daniel De Los Santos Marin (77M), Member ID: U7183854101, Ambetter-ATC insurance
workflowSteps.comments: Insurance verification successful - active coverage confirmed, requesting provider: Dr. Amanda Reynolds

workflowSteps.details: Analyzed post-MI status, cardiac catheterization results, echocardiogram findings, and laboratory values
workflowSteps.outcome: Recent NSTEMI (02/05/2025) with PCI and stent placement to left circumflex and RCA. Ejection fraction 60-65%, Grade I diastolic dysfunction. Elevated troponin (2.5 ng/mL). Multiple cardiac risk factors present
workflowSteps.comments: Patient meets Class I indication for cardiac rehabilitation post-MI with PCI per AHA/ACC guidelines

workflowSteps.details: Evaluated cardiac rehabilitation necessity based on recent MI, PCI, and cardiac risk factors
workflowSteps.outcome: High medical necessity score (98%) - Patient is ideal candidate for Phase II cardiac rehabilitation with documented recent NSTEMI, successful revascularization, and multiple modifiable risk factors
workflowSteps.comments: Cardiac rehabilitation strongly indicated for secondary prevention and functional recovery post-MI

workflowSteps.details: Verified coverage criteria for cardiac rehabilitation services under Ambetter policy
workflowSteps.outcome: Meets all policy requirements - recent MI with PCI within 12 months, physician referral, medically stable for outpatient program
workflowSteps.comments: All coverage criteria satisfied per CMS NCD 20.10 and Ambetter cardiac rehab policy

workflowSteps.details: Calculated estimated costs for 36-session cardiac rehabilitation program
workflowSteps.outcome: Total estimated cost: $5,500 (36 sessions over 12 weeks at ~$153 per session)
workflowSteps.comments: Cost within reasonable range for cardiac rehabilitation. Evidence shows cost-effectiveness with 20-30% reduction in mortality and rehospitalization

workflowSteps.details: AI analysis of cardiac data, risk factors, and guideline compliance
workflowSteps.outcome: Recommendation: APPROVE - Clear medical necessity with high confidence (97%). Strong evidence for improved outcomes with cardiac rehab post-MI
workflowSteps.comments: Patient has preserved EF but multiple risk factors (HTN, dyslipidemia, CKD 3B) requiring comprehensive rehabilitation program

workflowSteps.details: Generated approval letter and authorization number for 36 cardiac rehabilitation sessions
workflowSteps.outcome: Authorization #PA-2024-008-APPROVED issued for cardiac rehabilitation program
workflowSteps.comments: Authorization valid for 12 weeks from start date (02/14/2025), 3 sessions per week

keyFindings.clinicalJustification: 77-year-old male with recent NSTEMI (02/05/2025) requiring emergent PCI with dual stent placement. Post-procedure echocardiogram shows preserved ejection fraction (60-65%) with Grade I diastolic dysfunction. Multiple cardiac risk factors including hypertension, dyslipidemia (coronary risk 5.4), and CKD 3B require comprehensive secondary prevention.
keyFindings.medicalNecessity: High medical necessity (98%) - Cardiac rehabilitation is strongly indicated post-MI with PCI. Evidence-based guidelines (AHA/ACC Class I recommendation) demonstrate 20-30% reduction in cardiovascular mortality and improved functional capacity with structured cardiac rehab programs.
keyFindings.policyCompliance: Meets all coverage criteria for cardiac rehabilitation services. Patient has qualifying diagnosis (NSTEMI with PCI), is medically stable for outpatient program, has physician referral, and falls within 12-month post-MI window per CMS NCD 20.10.
keyFindings.costEfficiency: Cost-effective intervention - $5,500 for 36-session program provides superior value compared to potential costs of recurrent MI, rehospitalization, or cardiovascular complications. Evidence shows significant healthcare cost savings through prevention of adverse events.

coverageDetails.program: Phase II Cardiac Rehabilitation - 36 sessions over 12 weeks
coverageDetails.components: Supervised exercise training, cardiac risk factor modification, nutrition counseling, psychosocial support, patient education

recommendations.immediate: Approve cardiac rehabilitation program - 36 sessions over 12 weeks starting 02/14/2025
recommendations.followUp: Monitor cardiac rehab attendance and progress. Reassess risk factors at 6-week and 12-week intervals
recommendations.monitoring: Track exercise capacity improvements, medication adherence, blood pressure control, lipid panel optimization, and patient-reported quality of life
recommendations.education: Comprehensive patient education on cardiac diet, medication compliance (especially dual antiplatelet therapy), exercise progression, smoking cessation, and recognition of cardiac warning symptoms

systemNotes.automationTrigger: Recent MI with PCI and multiple cardiac risk factors triggered automated approval pathway per evidence-based guidelines
systemNotes.humanReview: No human review required - clear Class I indication for cardiac rehabilitation post-MI with PCI
systemNotes.exceptionHandling: No exceptions identified - standard post-MI cardiac rehab approval case
systemNotes.auditTrail: Complete audit trail maintained for all decision points, clinical data sources, and guideline references
